update.description:
See issue #1036.

* Only the world files that are currently working are installed.

* The broken words are saved in worlds/broken_worlds

* Added a test file for checking that all the world files contained in the worlds directory are SDF compliant.

* Fix some world files.

Some open questions:

* force_torque_demo2.world: Fails due to <implicit_damping> label. Should this label be removed/replaced?

* double_pendulums.world: no error messages but I don't see anything in gazebo.
update.title: Issue #1036

content.raw: may be `outdated` or `deprecated` sounds better than `broken`? In any case, looks good, approved.

content.raw: [Jenkins build just failed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/301/console) due to a typo that I fixed in cc75ffd. I'm running the tests again.

update.title: Issue #1036

content.raw:
The cmake file and the above test would be cleaner if all the worlds in the `worlds` directory were installed. A subdirectory called something like `broken_worlds` could contain all the worlds that don't work.

The test could then iterate over all files in the `worlds` directory, and the cmake file won't need a special comment.
content.html:
The cmake file and the above test would be cleaner if all the worlds in the worlds directory were installed. A subdirectory called something like broken_worlds could contain all the worlds that don't work.

The test could then iterate over all files in the worlds directory, and the cmake file won't need a special comment.

content.raw: Agreed. This should be classified as a broken world, and it'll help remind us to fix model nesting.
content.html: Agreed. This should be classified as a broken world, and it'll help remind us to fix model nesting.
